intro: Bupleurum nordmannianum, commonly known as the northern bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
